remarks: The identity morphism in the product of categories.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jan-2017.)
statement:
xpccat.t $e |- T = ( C Xc. D ) $.
xpccat.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
xpccat.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
xpccat.x $e |- X = ( Base ` C ) $.
xpccat.y $e |- Y = ( Base ` D ) $.
xpccat.i $e |- I = ( Id ` C ) $.
xpccat.j $e |- J = ( Id ` D ) $.
xpcid.1 $e |- .1. = ( Id ` T ) $.
xpcid.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. X ) $.
xpcid.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. Y ) $.
xpcid $p |- ( ph -> ( .1. ` <. R , S >. ) = <. ( I ` R ) , ( J ` S ) >. ) $.
